defect.para: Pursuant to Part 573.5, this Vehicle Safety Defect Initial Information Report is submitted by Navistar International Transportation Corp. Reference NHTSA Recall number 98E-012.
This report relates to certain 22.5 X 8.25 15-degree tubeless one-piece aluminum dual wheels manufactured by:
Our contact at AKW is Mr. George F. Anderson (330) 665-6900.
(2) VEHICLE MODELS INVOLVED: All Models that use certain 22.5 X 8.25 15-degree one-piece aluminum dual wheels.
(4) OTHER IDENTIFICATION NECESSARY TO DESCRIBE VEHICLES: Certain 22.5 X 8.25 15-degree one-piece aluminum dual wheels
(6) VEHICLE POPULATION INVOLVED: 3041, The quantity represents the total suspect population that contains the AKW 22.5 X 8.25 15-degree tubeless one-piece aluminum dual wheels in question.
(7) PORTION OF POPULATION ESTIMATED TO CONTAIN DEFECT: 100%
(8) DESCRIPTION OF DEFECT: Certain design revisions combined with process conditions can cause potential fatigue cracks under severe loading and/or environmental conditions.

(9) RISK TO MOTOR VEHICLE SAFETY: Potential fatigue cracks can cause potential wheel failures. Over a period of time, with cracks developing from handhole to handhole a wheel separation could result. This defect could cause a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.

(10) CHRONOLOGY OF PRINCIPAL EVENTS WHICH LED TO DETERMINATION OF A SAFETY DEFECT: Navistar was informed by AKW on their intent to recall vehicles manufactured with the subject wheels per NHTSA recall number 98E-012 on May 6, 1998. Navistar was furnished a list of part numbers, quantities, and ship dates; and was requested to supply customer names and addresses. An investigation was initiated. Vehicle owner information was sent to AKW on June 9, 1998.
(11) PROGRAM TO BE TAKEN TO REMEDY DEFECT: AKW to replace wheels.
(12) THE SCHEDULE FOR THIS RECALL IS: AKW to provide recall schedule and quarterly completion reports.
(13) OWNER LETTER AND TECHNICAL LETTER: Will be provided by AKW.
Rick Van Laar should be contacted for any additional information regarding this recall on (219) 461-1890.
